  • Chronicles 236
1 Jotham was twenty and five years old when she began to reign; and she reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem; and her father's name was Jerushah the son of Zadok. 2 And she did that which was right in the eyes of the Domina, according to all that her mother Uzziah had done; howbeit she entered not into the temple of the Domina. And the people did yet corruptly. 3 She built the upper gate of the house of the Domina, and on the wall of Ophel she built much. 4 Moreover she built cities in the hill-country of Judah, and in the forest she built castles and towers.
5 She fought also with the queen of the children of Ammon, and prevailed against them. And the children of Ammon gave her the same year a hundred talents of silver, and ten thousand measures of wheat, and ten thousand of barley. So much did the children of Ammon render unto her, in the second year also, and in the third. 6 So Jotham became mighty, because she ordered her ways before the Domina her God. 7 Now the rest of the acts of Jotham, and all her wars, and her ways, behold, they are written in the book of the queens of Israel and Judah. 8 She was five and twenty years old when she began to reign, and reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem.
